summary: Xocial.Stream is live on ICP via Caffeine and has evolved into a lightweight, calm video-sharing app with a strict 'no clutter' principle and explicit manager approval required before builds. Key UX/features implemented and deployed through iterations include: persisted upload status states (Uploading→Processing→Live), Continue Watching (quiet resume), search + categories discovery, automatic + manual thumbnails, and deletion permissions (users delete only their own videos; admin can delete any). Sharing UX was iterated and ultimately kept minimal (Copy Link + Timestamp only), with external social share + QR removed. Admin-only tooling is grouped under an Admin dropdown (Principal ID, Architecture, Payment Settings) and admin visibility remains identity/session dependent across browsers (Chrome vs Edge). Stripe setup remained fragile at times (save/load failures, pricing page 'Payment configuration not available'), leading to temporary Stripe Settings access paths; paid plan buttons were eventually restored to working. Footer/navigation direction continued toward a minimal TuoraSystems-branded footer (Pricing/Terms/Privacy/Support) and removing Architecture from public UI; Community & Ethics Policy is intended to be linked contextually (e.g., Upload/Pricing) rather than duplicated in the footer. Pricing copy/heading was updated again with 'Start Free, Grow Limitless. Plans and Pricing Made Simple.' plus homepage tagline 'Upload everything. Share without limits.' and Pro blurb 'Finally, a video platform without storage anxiety. Unlimited video. One simple price.' Creator Plus plan marketing remains restricted to only implemented features (Custom branding + Private collections), deferring analytics/password protection/scheduling promises.

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication provider
existing_features.description: Provides application-wide authentication via Internet Identity using @dfinity/auth-client, persisting delegation identity across reloads and exposing login/logout/status flags through a React context (InternetIdentityProvider/useInternetIdentity).

existing_features.title: Backend actor creation with identity + access-control initialization
existing_features.description: Creates an anonymous or authenticated canister actor depending on login state, and calls backend.initializeAccessControl() for authenticated users; on identity change, invalidates/refetches dependent React Query caches.

existing_features.title: Role-based access control (admin/user/guest)
existing_features.description: Backend enforces permissions for user and admin operations. First principal to initialize becomes admin; admins can assign roles and perform privileged operations.

existing_features.title: Persistent admin session in browser storage
existing_features.description: Stores verified admin principal in localStorage with session versioning and automatic revalidation/force reactivation; used to restore admin UI affordances across reloads.

existing_features.title: Admin verification banner and admin navigation controls
existing_features.description: Automatically verifies admin access on login, displays a dismissible banner when admin privileges are confirmed, and conditionally shows admin navigation (Stripe settings, admin dropdown).

existing_features.title: User profile storage and onboarding modal
existing_features.description: Allows authenticated users to create/save a simple profile (name). If no profile exists, a modal prompts the user to set their name; profiles can be fetched for the caller and (with backend authorization) for other principals.

existing_features.title: Video upload with category selection and upload progress
existing_features.description: Authenticated users can upload a video with title/description/category (including custom categories). The frontend streams bytes via ExternalBlob and supports progress callbacks; backend enforces a Free plan limit (10 uploads/month).

existing_features.title: Automatic thumbnail capture from video during upload
existing_features.description: Upload UI can capture a thumbnail frame from the selected video using an offscreen video element + canvas and send it as an image file with the upload request.

existing_features.title: Custom thumbnail upload/update for owners and admins
existing_features.description: Video owners or admins can upload a custom image thumbnail for an existing video; the backend validates ownership/admin permission and stores thumbnail blob + type.

existing_features.title: Video browsing, grid display, and navigation
existing_features.description: Displays all videos in a responsive grid with uploader info, like counts, category badges, share actions, and owner/admin delete controls; clicking a card navigates to the video playback page.

existing_features.title: Featured videos section
existing_features.description: Homepage can show a featured videos section sourced from backend.getFeaturedVideos(); backend supports featured status in metadata (admin-only setter exists).

existing_features.title: Video playback page with metadata and sharing
existing_features.description: Provides a video player using direct blob URLs, displays uploader profile, upload date, category badge, description, and includes sharing tools (copy link and timestamped link).

existing_features.title: Likes system (like/unlike + counts)
existing_features.description: Authenticated users can like/unlike videos; backend prevents duplicate likes and tracks likeCount; UI invalidates relevant queries after mutations.

existing_features.title: Comments system (add, list, delete)
existing_features.description: Authenticated users can add comments to videos; comments are listed per video and can be deleted by the author or an admin, with UI refresh via query invalidation.

existing_features.title: Video deletion with permission checks
existing_features.description: Video owners or admins can delete a video; backend also removes associated comments and likes. UI provides confirmation dialogs in both VideoPage and VideoGrid cards.

existing_features.title: Search and category filtering
existing_features.description: Homepage supports debounced search by title/description, category filter buttons, and combined search+category queries; backend implements search and category query endpoints.

existing_features.title: Categories discovery endpoint and UI filters
existing_features.description: Frontend fetches categories from backend and renders category filter buttons; backend computes categories from stored video metadata.

existing_features.title: Stripe configuration storage and retrieval (admin-managed)
existing_features.description: Backend stores Stripe API keys and plan checkout URLs in canister state; admin-only update endpoint and public fetch endpoint are consumed by the frontend. Admin UI (TempStripeSettingsPage) loads existing config and allows saving updates.

existing_features.title: Pricing page with Stripe checkout redirects
existing_features.description: Displays Free/Pro/Creator Plus plans; Free plan is informational, while paid plans redirect to configured Stripe Checkout URLs fetched from backend; shows a status alert when URLs are present.

existing_features.title: Stripe API integration via IC HTTP outcalls
existing_features.description: Backend can create Stripe checkout sessions and fetch session status using IC management canister http_request with a response transform; includes request body building and client_reference_id extraction for associating sessions to principals.

existing_features.title: Blob storage maintenance mixin for IC storage primitives
existing_features.description: Provides endpoints for storage gateway authorization refresh, checking blob liveness, enumerating dead blobs (authorized callers only), confirming deletion/pruning, and topping up a cashier canister with spare cycles.

existing_features.title: Static informational pages and architecture diagram page
existing_features.description: Includes pages for Community & Ethics Policy, Terms of Service, Privacy Policy, Support contact info, and an Architecture page showing a multi-canister ecosystem diagram and explanatory content.

existing_features.title: Camera utility hook
existing_features.description: Provides camera start/stop/switch/retry and photo capture to File using getUserMedia, with error typing and refs for a video/canvas element.

existing_features.title: QR scanning hook built on camera capture
existing_features.description: Loads jsQR dynamically, scans frames from the camera at a configurable interval, records recent QR results, and exposes start/stop/switch/clear controls plus readiness state.

existing_features.title: Admin Payment Settings page (Stripe keys + plan URLs) implemented
existing_features.description: Admin-accessible Payment Settings UI exists in the main frontend for editing/saving Stripe publishable/secret keys and Pro/Creator Plus checkout URLs stored in canister state (Free has no URL). Intended to replace/avoid reliance on an empty placeholder page and improve settings accessibility.

existing_features.title: GitHub export / ICP CLI build-template scaffold
existing_features.description: Repository now includes a build-template scaffold (Dockerfile, icp.yaml, deploy.sh, frontend/backend canister yamls, scripts for image pruning/resizing, and workspace/package configs) to support exporting/building/deploying the app consistently via ICP tooling.

existing_features.title: Video route error boundary for crash containment
existing_features.description: Frontend adds a route/page-level error boundary around Video pages to prevent full-app crashes in production and provide a controlled fallback when rendering/runtime errors occur (e.g., React minified errors).

existing_features.title: Banned words moderation tooling (admin page)
existing_features.description: Adds an admin-facing UI surface for managing/viewing a banned-words list to support lightweight moderation/content-policy enforcement workflows (foundation for future automated flagging/gating).

existing_features.title: FAQ static informational page
existing_features.description: Adds a dedicated FAQ page to host common questions/answers as a lightweight informational surface alongside existing Terms/Privacy/Support/Policy pages.

architectural_notes: Internet Computer canister architecture: a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo with modularized helpers (authorization, stripe, http-outcalls, blob-storage mixin).

Role-based access control (RBAC) implemented in backend/authorization/access-control.mo; first non-anonymous caller to initialize becomes admin; roles persisted in an OrderedMap inside canister state.
Frontend uses an Actor abstraction (useActor) to create authenticated/anonymous canister actors; actor initialization calls initializeAccessControl() after login.
Data layer uses TanStack React Query with dedicated hooks (useQueries.ts) for each backend call, plus query invalidation on mutations and on actor identity changes.

Video storage uses ExternalBlob references (IC storage primitives) and a blob-storage mixin exposing maintenance/admin endpoints (gateway principal authorization, dead blob pruning confirmation, cashier refill).

Stripe integration is split: (a) backend Stripe API calls via IC http_request outcalls (backend/stripe/stripe.mo + backend/http-outcalls/outcall.mo) and (b) a separate persistent StripeConfigAndUrls configuration stored in canister state and editable via an admin UI.

Admin UX includes a persistent admin session stored in browser localStorage (adminSession.ts) with session versioning and revalidation mechanisms; admin verification is done via backend verifyAdminAccess/isCallerAdmin queries.
UI is built with TailwindCSS (OKLCH token system), shadcn/ui components, lucide-react icons, and toast notifications (sonner).
Routing is handled by TanStack Router with a shared layout including Header, Footer, AdminVerificationBanner, and ProfileSetupModal.

known_issues: Security/ops: backend/main.mo currently hardcodes live Stripe publishable/secret keys and live checkout URLs in the initial canister state; secrets should not be committed or exposed via getStripeConfigAndUrls() (which currently returns secretKey to any caller).
Stripe API helper buildCheckoutSessionBody() sets shipping_address_collection[allowed_countries][0] for every country, overwriting the same index; should increment the index.
getCurrentMonth() approximates months as 30-day blocks (dayOfYear/30) and years as 365 days; this will drift from real calendar months and can reset upload counts inaccurately.
Comment IDs are generated via debug_show(Time.now()); rapid successive comments can collide at nanosecond granularity depending on execution context; better to use a counter/UUID.
Frontend like state (VideoPage.tsx) uses local isLiked state without fetching whether the current user already liked the video; UI may be incorrect on page load/refresh.
getAllCategories() lowercases categories but does not deduplicate; may return duplicates and loses original casing semantics.

Access control bootstrap requirement: many backend calls trap with "User is not registered" until initializeAccessControl() is called for that principal; the frontend calls it on actor creation, but any alternative client could hit traps unexpectedly.
blob-storage/Storage.mo contains typos/unused state fields (e.g., blobTodeletete) and authorized gateway principals require an explicit update call; there is no automated refresh scheduling.
http-outcalls/outcall.mo uses a fixed cycle allowance (231B cycles) and a static User-Agent; failure modes/cycle exhaustion are not handled beyond trapping.
